Experience: Conducted research on effect of complex material behavior and illumination on 3D reconstruction algorithms:

Several problems that arise in 3D reconstruction are highly non-convex. My PhD thesis proposes branch-and-bound algorithms based on efficient convex relaxations that can provably achieve the global minimum for such problems.

Developed a real-time stereo-based structure-from-motion system that uses lines as primary features. This is important in indoor applications where point features (such as corners) used by traditional systems are rare.

Developed a system that uses stereo input and polarization filters to perform segmentation and compute distance of user’s hand or fingers from a horizontal touch screen. This is used as input for gesture-based controls that guide applications like interactive navigation or games.
Qualcomm Chancellor's Chair in Robot Systems

A platform that makes it simple to build smart, safe, cooperative, autonomous, and robust applications for robots. By building the world’s first industrial grade cognitive engine, combining the best of deep learning, common sense reasoning and classical AI. Customers: Companies who want to move beyond static automation into genuine autonomy for robots that operate in dynamic, open-ended environments. Us: an unsurpassed team of veterans in robotics, AI, and business.

ROBO-STOX, LLC created the world’s first index to benchmark the value of robotics, automation and related technologies: The ROBO-STOX™ Global Robotics and Automation Index. By creating a representative portfolio of the industry, ROBO-STOX™ allows investors potentially to capitalize on the robotics trend as it continues to grow. ROBO-STOX changed name to ROBO Global October 2015. ROBO global is traded under the ROBO symbol in US and Europe (UK, DE).

Professor of Computer Science and Engineering at the Jacobs School of Engineering. Doing research on robotics and vision. The main emphasis is on Human Robot Interaction, Cognitive Systems, Sensory Fusion and Systems Integration. The research must have a strong theoretical foundation, a clear algorithmic basis, an efficient implementation and be evaluated under real conditions.

Biota is an exciting startup that applies microbiome data science to industrial applications, starting with oil and gas. It is founded on the tools and principles that have made my laboratory's human microbiome studies so successful, while taking into account the unique characteristics of extractive industries.

Involved in the design and implementation of automated information retrieval system for medical domain.

Undergrad dissertation: (Supervisor: Prof. Anupam Basu) Developed schemes for behavioral modeling and simulation of analog and mixed-signal systems in SDL-C. A comparative work of SPICE and SDL-C is done as a part of it. A digital communication system was designed in both SPICE and SDL-C. The project was a National Semiconductor’s sponsored project.
Experience: Study fundamental invariant principles in normal and disease context.

This lab focuses on developing high-throughput data analysis techniques towards understanding complex biological processes in human normal and diseased tissues. We identify simple Boolean patterns in high-dimensional datasets and correlate them to the underlying biological processes. We have successfully applied this concept in blood stem cell differentiation, bladder cancer, colon cancer and prostate cancer. Currently we are building diease maps, identifying prognostic biomarkers and therapeutic targets for various diseases including  pediatric leukemia, colon cancer, gastric cancer, IBD, NASH/NAFLD, and Alzheimer's etc.
Developing algorithms to characterize stem and progentor cells.

For the first time, we showed that exploring the Boolean state space of large state transition systems could be efficiently parallelized using multithreading [Sahoo et al. DAC 2005] (Joint work with Dr. Jawahar Jain, FLA). Our tool is being used largely in Fujitsu labs. Analysis of large Boolean state space is an extensively studied area of research and heavily used in verification of large digital systems.
Worked for one year in Verification Technology Group in Synopsys.
Involved in design, implementation and analysis of algorithms to improve the performance of VCS (a popular Verilog simulator).
